title: Business live: 22 June 2015 - BBC News
summary: greek shares jump on optimism over a deal .
hollande says greek reform proposals an 'improvement ' .
altice makes bid for bouygues telecom .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's all from me today .
join us tomorrow from 06:00 for more news from greece and also news from royal bank of scotland 's annual shareholder meeting .
until then !
author: Howard Mustoe
Business reporter

documents.title: wall street close
text: us stocks advanced , with the tech stock-focused nasdaq ending at a record high , building on hope that a deal would be reached that would prevent greece from defaulting on its debts .
the

documents.title: when mario met alexis
text: european central bank president mario draghi told greek prime minister alexis tsipras that greece 's banking system would remain protected as long as the country stuck with the bailout plan , a greek government official said , according to reuters .
`` draghi assured tsipras that the banking system is safe as long as greece is in a programme , '' the official told reporters after the two men met in brussels .

documents.title: diamond deals
text: namibia wants to review its diamond mining joint venture with anglo america 's de beers to ensure more stones are cut and polished locally , information minister tjekero tweya said .
fun fact : namibia 's marine diamonds are vacuumed up off the ocean floor .
from the joint-venture it owns equally with de beers , namibia has been keeping only 10 % of the stones for local processing , but now it wants its share increased to 30 % .

documents.title: us healthcare merger
text: us health insurer anthem shrugged off concerns that buying smaller rival cigna could stoke competition concerns .

`` we believe there is a consensus of where there is overlap between our companies and that no substantive antitrust or insurance regulatory issues are present that would prevent completion of the transaction , '' anthem ceo joseph swedish said .
anthem said on saturday it had offered to buy cigna for $ 47bn .

documents.title: martha stewart deal
text: domestic queen martha stewart 's media and merchandising firm martha stewart living omnimedia will be sold for $ 353m in a cash-and-stock deal to sequential brands group .
who they ?
sequential brands owns justin timberlake 's william rast clothing brand and bought a majority stake in the jessica simpson brand in april .

documents.title: productivity gap
text: britain 's reserve of spare labour is running out , which should help low british productivity to grow as companies focus on less labour-intensive forms of production , bank of england deputy governor jon cunliffe told a conference .
poor productivity growth -britain 's biggest economic challenge - should improve gradually over the next few years , he said , mirroring his employer 's forecast last month .

documents.title: dilbert
text: today 's dilbert follows the theme of

documents.title: france : greek outlines are an 'improvement '
text: france 's president francois hollande said new greek reform proposals were an `` improvement '' but a debt deal was still not immediately possible .

`` i hope that the work in the last few days between greece and the [ creditor ] institutions will provide the basis for a deal which must be made as soon as possible there have been improvements even if not everything is in order . ''

documents.title: merkel on greece
text: the german chancellor , angela merkel , says there is no basis on which greece 's creditors could make a decision : `` after the eurogroup meeting there is no basis for a decision , so this can only be an advisory summit . ''

documents.title: altice-bouygues deal
text: the french government will look at how altice 's offer to buy bouygues telecom will affect employment and investment , french prime minister manuel valls said .

`` [ economy minister ] emmanuel macron will indeed seek to ensure there are neither social consequences , nor loss of employment , but especially that we keep our goals in terms of development , '' valls told france 's bfm tv .

documents.title: eu president 's verdict
text: eu president donald tusk said new reform suggestions made by the greek government are the first `` real '' step forward by athens for weeks .

`` the latest greek proposals are the first real proposals in many weeks although they still need , it 's obvious for me , the assessment of the ( creditor ) institutions and further work , of course , '' tusk told reporters .

documents.title: giorgos stathakis interview
text: you can now see a video of greece 's economy minister giorgos stathakis 's interview with the bbc 's robert peston

documents.title: market update
text: a more optimistic mood is to be found in european stock markets as greek debt talks continue .
london 's benchmark

documents.title: wind projects
text: about 250 onshore wind projects already being developed are likely to be cancelled because the government is ending subsidies which would aid their completion , energy secretary amber rudd said .
the funding cut will mean that 2,500 turbines which were due to be built are scrapped , ms rudd said .

documents.title: via twitter
text: next # rbs chairman ( from sept 1 ) sir howard davies has delayed joining the bank , until his uk airports commission is published
author: Douglas Fraser
Business and economy editor, Scotland

documents.title: likely lada lag looms
text: russian automaker avtovaz - they make lada cars - has stopped production because of problems with its supply line , according to reuters , which cites a company spokesman .
`` today avtovaz stopped car assembly lines because of complications with the supply of components , '' said the spokesman to reuters .
`` avtovaz is intensively negotiating with suppliers to promptly resume production , '' he said .

documents.title: greek stocks rise
text: the biggest winners among greek shares were the banks .
alpha bank rose 24 % , piraeus bank advanced 21 % and national bank of greece jumped 20 % .
eurobank , the fourth-best performer , climbed 19 % .

documents.title: greek stocks rise
text: greece 's main stock exchange jumped 9 % by the end of trading amid market optimism that the country was near a deal with its creditors to release the much-needed bailout funds .
the index advanced 61.84 to end the day at 749.17 .

documents.title: via twitter
text: very short eurogroup press conference since no progress made .
imf 's christine lagarde did n't even turn up .
@ twitterid she 's probably tired of doing the hokey cokey !
@ twitterid it 's as if sophocles was writing the story.mind , i think even he would struggle to come up with such a tragedy .

b ) is ela legit ?

author: Andrew Neil
Daily and Sunday Politics presenter

documents.title: stathakis : greece rescued
text: according to robert 's interview with mr stathakis , greece will raise money three ways : a new tax on businesses , a new tax on the wealthy , and some increases in the vat rate on selected items .
there would be no further reductions in pensions or public-sector wages , he said .
and , he said , more work would need to be done in the coming days finish the fine print of a deal .

documents.title: via blog
text: economics editor robert peston has just interviewed greek economy minister giorgos stathakis .
mr stathakis believes greece 's new proposals to balance the government 's books have broken the deadlock with its creditors .

he said he expects eurozone government heads to issue a communique later today that will say there is now a basis for a formal agreement with athens to complete the current bailout programme and release €7.2bn of vital funds .
author: Robert Peston
Economics editor

documents.title: via twitter
text: farcical really .
greek plans came too late for full assessment so another eurogroup this wk , says @ twitterid what 's point of summit ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid 48hour work week legal maximum !
eu law !
author: Danny Kemp
Brussels deputy bureau chief for @AFP news agency

documents.title: more talks
text: jeroen dijsselbloem , the dutch finance minister who heads the eurozone finance ministers ' meetings , said negotiators would be using proposals made this weekend by greek prime minister alexis tsipras as a basis for further talks .
`` it 's an opportunity to get that deal this week , '' he said .
`` if necessary - and if all goes well , it will be necessary - the euro group will have another meeting later this week to hear from the final outcome of the talks with the greek authorities . ''

documents.title: grexit no disaster for eurozone
text: a greek exit from the eurozone would not mean the end of the euro , commerzbank chief executive martin blessing is quoted as saying in french financial daily les echos today .
the commerzbank boss questions whether greece will leave the euro if it defaults on its debt and says even if it does there is no reason why other countries would follow .
`` that would be the case if greece did much better after leaving , but how likely is that ?
argentina is not a very convincing example , '' he adds .

documents.title: airline attack
text: polish airline lot 's chief executive has elaborated on a hack the company suffered which caused 1,400 passengers to be grounded at warsaw 's chopin airport on sunday .
`` this is an industry problem on a much wider scale , and for sure we have to give it more attention , if it can be given more attention , '' sebastian mikosz told a news conference .
`` i expect it can happen to anyone anytime . ''
that 's all from matthew and ben today , but do n't worry ; they will return from 06:00 .
until then , i 'll be guiding you through the afternoon and evening 's business news .
author: Howard Mustoe
Business reporter

text: `` everyday we have to try very hard to calm our staff , we have to try very hard to calm our clients , '' the chairman of greece 's fourth biggest bank , nikolaos karamouzis
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: greece : 'wasted air miles '
text: there are fairly low expectations of what can be achieved today says bbc europe correspondent , damian grammaticas on the world at one .
it 's reported that the finnish finance minister said he thought everyone `` had wasted a lot of air miles '' coming to brussels today , according to damian .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: starbucks ' small farmers fund
text: starbucks ' small farmers fund

documents.title: dire warning from greek bank boss
text: if i had any doubts about the dire state of the greek banking system , and why it matters so much for the greek government to reach an agreement with creditors today to escape default , those doubts were dispelled in an interview with the chairman of greece 's fourth biggest bank , nikolaos karamouzis .

he warned there was a genuine risk of greek banks being forced to close their doors tomorrow and cease dispensing cash for days , if the greek government led by alexis tsipras fails today to convince eurozone finance ministers and government heads that it is taking credible steps to balance its books .
read more from robert 's blog here .
author: Robert Peston
Economics editor

documents.title: schaeuble : 'nothing new from greece '
text: trust wolfgang schaeuble to take the fizz out of today 's negotiations over greece .
the german finance minister has told reporters that the eurogroup does not have new proposals to work on .
mr schaeuble says the group has not received any `` substantial '' policy proposals since last thursday .
he adds the imf has n't received any proposals from greece either .

documents.title: russia preparing 'retaliatory measures ' over eu sanctions
text: away from greece , reuters is reporting that russian prime minister dmitry medvedev is preparing `` retaliatory measures '' after the european union decided to extend economic sanctions against his country for its ongoing involvement in eastern ukraine .

documents.title: need for honesty in greece talks
text: `` everyone in greece wants to stay in the euro , everyone wants less austerity .
it 's just the order switches around from day to day , '' yannis baboulias , a greek freelance journalist tells the bbc .
in terms of uncertainty and how everyone will react to an exit from the euro , the greek people know such an exit would mean more , not less austerity , he adds .
but the idea that the greeks are `` not the grown-ups in the room is a bit laughable after so many months , '' he says .
there are disagreements between the imf and the european commission over how to proceed , he says , and now there is a need for honest discussions .

documents.title: greek deal in daysagence france presse reporter tweets
text: alex pigman
parisnewsroom
hollande and merkel separately refer to greece deal in the `` coming days '' , reducing expectations for big announcements tonight .
hollande and merkel separately refer to greece deal in the `` coming days '' , reducing expectations for big announcements tonight .

documents.title: merkel : still time to reach a deal
text: eurozone leaders meeting in brussels later today are unlikely to be able to take a formal decision on whether to provide aid to greece , but there is still time this week to finalise a deal , german chancellor angela merkel has said .
`` there are still a lot of days in the week in which decisions can be taken , '' mrs merkel said to reporters on visit to the east german city of magdeburg .
but she said without an agreement between greece and its creditors this evening 's summit could be no more than a discussion forum .

documents.title: another €1.3bn for greek banks
text: the ecb has raised its borrowing facility for greek banks by €1.3bn in financing for greek banks , according to the bbc 's gavin lee in brussels .

documents.title: greece : 'no decisive end '
text: `` some sort of deal may finally be on the way , but it is unlikely to bring the greek crisis to a decisive end , '' says jonathan loynes , chief european economist , at capital economics in a research note .
he points out that here have been `` brief bursts of optimism '' in the past .
a deal will need to come together very quickly to prevent a default on debts owed to the imf , he says .
mr loynes also thinks that greece needs a 50 % write-off of its debts .

text: german economy minister sigmar gabriel ( on left ) has told

documents.title: juncker comments on deal outlook
text: the president of the european commission jean-claude juncker has reportedly said : `` i do n't know if we will have an agreement today , '' which , if you think about it , is a reasonable thing to say .
but in the fraught atmosphere

documents.title: greece : 'cautious optimism '
text: `` we can be cautiously optimistic , '' former greek finance minister george papaconstantinou on bbc world news .
he says that the latest proposals from greece bridge some of the gap with its international creditors .
a lot will depend on whether the eu will tonight give prime minister tsipras `` some kind of a pledge for debt relief down the road '' .
that could result in an agreement , or the indication of an agreement tonight , he said .
author: World Service

documents.title: greek shares leap on deal hopes
text: greek shares have rebounded today rising 6.8 % in morning trade on the athens stock exchange as hopes that a deal between greece and europe could be brokered soon .
last week greek shares fell more than 11 % .
the country 's banking sector was the top gainer so far this morning up 15 % .

documents.title: report : ecb extends lifeline to greek banks
text: the european central bank ( ecb ) has extended its lifeline to greek banks according to reuters .
it is the third time in six days that the ecb has raised the amount greek banks can draw from the central bank .
greek savers withdrew €4bn of funds last week and had pre-ordered another €1bn for today , reuters reported .

documents.title: former greek pm calls for softer european approach
text: europe needs to be `` softer on the fiscal side and put all the emphasis on development and that would involve alleviating some of the debt in one way or another , ''
author: BBC World News

documents.title: thorntons - some context
text: thorntons has been through a very rough patch recently .

documents.title: greece will still need help after deal
text: ms pryce adds that greece 's debt mountain will need to be dealt with eventually .
that means a rescheduling of that debt she tells business live .
`` greeks would probably accept most of the demands of the [ country 's ] creditors if there is some recognition that the overall debt burden is so high and needs to be addressed , she says .
author: Business Live
Business Live

documents.title: greek deal more politics than economics
text: vicky pryce chief economic adviser to the centre of economic and business research ( cebr ) tells the bbc 's business live : `` the difference from an economic viewpoint is very small in terms of what the greeks have been offering and what their creditors want . ''
`` it 's political now , '' she adds .
author: Business Live

documents.title: how long to greek capital controls ?
text: all over europe regulators and politicians are preparing in case of failure by eurozone government-head talks that would avert default by the greek government , and for a probable acceleration of withdrawals from greek banks , a run in all but name .

the point is that greek banks are very close to the absolute limit of how much they can be funded by the european central bank and the bank of greece - in that around a third of their lending and assets is financed by the respective central and national banks in this way .

if deposit withdrawals continue at the current pace , greek banks will soon exhaust eligible assets they can pledge to the bank of greece for cash under the emergency liquidity assistance ( ela ) scheme .
that could happen in days , according to banking sources .
read more from robert 's blog here
author: Robert Peston
Economics editor

documents.title: good morning
text: morning folks .
it 's very difficult to find any other business news than the greek debt crisis this morning .
that probably wo n't come as a surprise to most given today 's emergency summit .
we 'll bring you the latest from that as it happens as well as any other news we unearth .
author: Matthew West
Business Reporter
